para.caption: Mailinglist for XP-developers
para.text:
Like many other development teams, the XP core team employs a mailinglist to discuss and announce changes and keep track of anything regarding our code.
For these reasons, we at xp-framework.net offer an unmoderated list for developers.

para.caption: How to subscribe?
para.text:
We use ezmlm, so to subscribe just send an email to xp-subscribe@php3.de. You will be replied and then need to confirm your subscription by answering that mail.
If you need help with ezmlm, just send an empty message to xp-help@php3.de.

para.caption: Charta, etiquette
para.text:
The mailinglist is used to discuss anything that has to do with the XP framework. That includes:
Any CVS commit in the public cvs
Any CVS tag in the public cvs
Questions about the framework that are not covered in our online-documentation at (www.xp-framework.net).
Additional information to certain classes (that do not fit into inline documentation). They should be written somewhere but an announcement on the list helps not to overlook it.
API changes that break backward compatibility MUST be announced (They even should be discussed before commit). [Note: classes that are marked as EXPERIMENTAL/NEEDS_WORK are allowed to be changed that way].
Generally it is a good idea for user of xp-framework to be subscribed on the list.
